Visualization Utilities¶

Visual helpers under visualization provide plotting routines for explaining recommendation pathways. The modules below document the available tree plotting interfaces and configuration knobs.

Render Guns and GRAIL recommendation trees as Graphviz diagrams.

class visualization.recommendation_tree_viz.SafeDict[source]¶

Bases: dict

Dictionary that returns an empty string for missing keys.

class visualization.recommendation_tree_viz.TreeData(root, nodes, edges)[source]¶

Bases: object

Container holding recommendation tree nodes and edges.

Parameters:

  • root (str)

  • nodes (Dict[str, Mapping[str, object]])

  • edges (List[TreeEdge])

edges: List[TreeEdge]¶
nodes: Dict[str, Mapping[str, object]]¶
root: str¶
class visualization.recommendation_tree_viz.TreeEdge(parent, child, rank=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Directed edge connecting two nodes in the recommendation tree.

Parameters:

  • parent (str)

  • child (str)

  • rank (int | None)

child: str¶
parent: str¶
rank: int | None = None¶
visualization.recommendation_tree_viz.aggregate_counts(sequences)[source]¶

Aggregate node and edge visitation counts from viewer trajectories.

Parameters:

sequences (Iterable[Sequence[str]]) – Iterable of node identifier sequences.

Returns:

Tuple of (node_counts, edge_counts).

Return type:

Tuple[Counter, Counter]

visualization.recommendation_tree_viz.build_graph(tree, *, metadata, label_template, wrap_width, highlight_path, node_counts, edge_counts, max_depth, rankdir, engine, show_rank_labels)[source]¶

Render a recommendation tree as a Graphviz graph.

Parameters:

  • tree (TreeData) – Tree structure to render.

  • metadata (Mapping[str, Mapping[str, object]]) – Supplemental metadata per node.

  • label_template (str) – Template used to render each node label.

  • wrap_width (int | None) – Optional wrapping width for labels.

  • highlight_path (Sequence[str]) – Sequence of nodes to emphasise.

  • node_counts (Counter) – Aggregated node view counts.

  • edge_counts (Counter) – Aggregated edge traversal counts.

  • max_depth (int | None) – Optional depth limit for rendered nodes.

  • rankdir (str) – Graphviz rank direction (e.g. "LR").

  • engine (str) – Graphviz layout engine.

  • show_rank_labels (bool) – Whether to annotate edges with recommendation rank.

Returns:

Configured graphviz.Digraph instance.

Return type:

graphviz.Digraph

visualization.recommendation_tree_viz.build_session_graph(rows, *, label_template, wrap_width, rankdir, engine, highlight_path)[source]¶

Visualise a single viewer session as a Graphviz graph.

Parameters:

  • rows (Sequence[Mapping[str, object]]) – Chronologically ordered session rows.

  • label_template (str) – Template used to render node labels.

  • wrap_width (int | None) – Optional wrapping width for labels.

  • rankdir (str) – Graph orientation (Graphviz rankdir attribute).

  • engine (str) – Graphviz layout engine to use.

  • highlight_path (Sequence[str]) – Sequence of video identifiers to highlight.

Returns:

Configured graphviz.Digraph instance.

Return type:

graphviz.Digraph

visualization.recommendation_tree_viz.compute_depths(tree)[source]¶

Compute the depth (distance from the root) for every node.

Parameters:

tree (TreeData) – Recommendation tree.

Returns:

Mapping of node identifiers to zero-based depth.

Return type:

Dict[str, int]

visualization.recommendation_tree_viz.format_node_label(node_id, *, node_data, metadata, template, wrap_width)[source]¶

Render a node label based on the configured template.

Parameters:

  • node_id (str) – Identifier of the node being rendered.

  • node_data (Mapping[str, object]) – Raw data associated with the node.

  • metadata (Mapping[str, Mapping[str, object]]) – Supplemental metadata keyed by node identifier.

  • template (str) – Python format string used for the label.

  • wrap_width (int | None) – Optional character width used to wrap the label.

Returns:

Formatted label string, including the node id when requested.

Return type:

str

visualization.recommendation_tree_viz.load_metadata(metadata_path, *, id_column='originId')[source]¶

Load per-node metadata to enrich node labels.

Parameters:

  • metadata_path (Path | None) – CSV, JSON, or JSONL file with metadata rows.

  • id_column (str) – Column containing the node identifier.

Returns:

Mapping from node identifier to metadata dictionaries.

Raises:

ValueError – If the identifier column is missing in a CSV file.

Return type:

Dict[str, Mapping[str, object]]

visualization.recommendation_tree_viz.load_trajectories(path, *, delimiter=',')[source]¶

Load viewer trajectories from text, CSV, or JSON representations.

Parameters:

  • path (Path | None) – Path to the trajectory file, or None to skip loading.

  • delimiter (str) – Delimiter used when parsing plain-text files.

Returns:

Normalised viewer trajectories as lists of identifiers.

Return type:

List[List[str]]

visualization.recommendation_tree_viz.load_tree_csv(csv_path, *, id_column='originId', child_prefixes=('rec',))[source]¶

Load a recommendation tree from a CSV export.

Parameters:

  • csv_path (Path) – Path to the CSV file generated by the recommender pipeline.

  • id_column (str) – Column name that stores the node identifier.

  • child_prefixes (Sequence[str]) – Column prefixes that denote recommendation targets.

Returns:

Populated TreeData describing the tree.

Raises:

ValueError – If the recommendation columns cannot be inferred.

Return type:

TreeData

Entry point for the recommendation tree visualiser.

Parameters:

argv (Sequence[str] | None) – Optional list of CLI arguments.

Raises:

SystemExit – When the command arguments are inconsistent.

Return type:

None

Parse CLI arguments for the recommendation visualiser.

Parameters:

argv (Sequence[str] | None) – Optional explicit argument vector.

Returns:

Parsed arguments namespace.

Raises:

SystemExit – If required arguments are missing.

Namespace

Parse comma-separated issue=count specifications.

spec (str)

visualization.recommendation_tree_viz.render_graph(graph, output_path, *, output_format)[source]¶

Render a Graphviz graph to disk, normalising the output path.

Parameters:

  • graph (graphviz.Digraph) – Graphviz graph to render.

  • output_path (Path) – Target output file path.

  • output_format (str | None) – Optional format override (otherwise inferred from output_path).

Returns:

Path to the rendered output file.

Return type:

Path
